content: drover & classer 5ply plain beanie size this hat fits everyone in my family from the 7 year old up to dad head circumference range approx 52-60cm 21-24 it has a generous depth to cater for the larger heads and to fully cover the ears when it s cold details for sizing up or down is provided in sizing note at end of pattern yarn 185-200m drover & classer australian superfine merino 5ply or any sport weight yarn gauge/gauge 24sts and 34 row over 4 in stocking stich on 3 75mm needles washed needles & notions tapestry needle 7 stitch markers 3 25mm 40cm/16 circular needles or dpns for brim 3 75mm 40cm/16 circular needles or dpns for body 3 75mm dpns for crown abbreviations st/ sts stitch/ stiches dpns double pointed needles or sock needles m stitch marker pm place marker not prime minister sm slip marker round- round k knit p purl pattern brim using the long tail cast on or another stretchy cast on such as the german twisted cast on with 3 25mm needles cast on 112 sts pm join to work in the round check to make sure your ring of stitches is not twisted check again after the first round work in k1 p1 rib for 1½ or desired ribbing depth 1 -3 is recommended body switch to 3 75mm needles knit in the round for 6 ½ or until total depth is 8 from cast on edge for less slouch knit to 7 crown shaping set up round k16 pm to end of round round 1 k to 2 st before m k2tog sm to end of round round 2 knit repeat rounds 1 and 2 until 2 sts remain between each m break yarn leaving a 6 tail thread tapestry needle and weave tail through remaining 14 sts fasten by weaving tail into inside of hat sizing note this pattern is easily knit smaller by casting on 104 sts for brim and increasing 1 st at beg of body 105 sts for a larger hat cast on 118 sts and increase 1 st at beg of body 119 sts crown shaping is a multiple of 7
